subject: Economics
title: The Skill Premium: How Technology Splits the Labor Market
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Skill Premium: How Technology Splits the Labor Market.

hook.text: Since 1980, wages for college graduates rose 25%. Wages for high school graduates fell 15%.

buildup.text: Technology complements high-skill workers: AI helps programmers code faster, Excel helps analysts analyze more.

discovery.text: David Autor found the 'hollowing out' of middle-skill jobs.

twist.text: The polarization creates a barbell economy.

climax.text: Technology doesn't eliminate work. It redistributes it.

punchline.text: Technology is great for workers â€” as long as they already have the right skills.

quiz.question: What is the 'hollowing out' of the labor market?
options: Routine middle-skill jobs are automated while high-skill and hard-to-automate low-skill jobs both grow, eliminating the middle class
